Kaltura.UseAppleAdaptive.doc: If apple HLS streams should be used when available.

Kaltura.LeadHLSOnAndroid.doc:
If Apple HLS streams should be used when available on Android devices, 
			by default progressive streams are used on Android because of Android HLS compatibility issues.

LeadWithHLSOnFlash.doc: If Apple HLS streams should be used when available on Desktop browsers with Flash.

autoPlay.doc: If the player should start playback once ready.

autoMute.doc: If set to true, player will start with audio muted. This will be respected across entries and ads, until the user enables volume in the player. Note some VPAID ads do not support auto mute.

closedCaptions.description: Reach multi-lingual audience and comply with FCC regulations with Kaltura multi-lingual closed captions support.

layout.doc: Layout mode for caption, on top of the video or below the video.

displayCaptions.doc: Should caption be displayed by default.

useCookie.doc: Should cookies be used to store user language.

fontFamily.doc: Top level font familiy for Captions text.

useGlow.doc: If the timed text should have a glow / shadow.

defaultLanguageKey.doc: The default language key for the player.

hideWhenEmpty.doc: If the caption button should be hidden when no captions are available for the current entry.

showEmbeddedCaptions.doc: Show captions embedded in the video file.

controlBarContainer.description: Control bar container, contains all the player controls.

hover.doc: If the controls should hover on the player, or not.

audioDescription.description: Audio description tracks, supports associating an audio file to be played at the same time as the video.

file.doc: The URL or custom data mapping to URL for the audio description track.

loadingSpinner.description: Loading spinner options allows you to customize the look of the loading spinner.

imageUrl.doc: An image URL, to use as the loading spinner. By default it is null. If a URL is provided, it will replace the dynamic loading spinner.

lines.doc: The number of lines to draw, 11 by default.

lineLength.doc: The length of each line, 10 pixels by default.

width.doc: The line thickness, 6 pixels thick by default.

radius.doc: The radius of the inner circle, 12 pixels thick by default.

corners.doc: Corner roundness (0..1), default 1 for fully rounded corners.

color.doc: An array of RGB colors delimited by |, or a single RGB style color string. By default uses the color wheel.

shadow.doc: Whether to render a shadow, false by default.

className.doc: The CSS class to assign to the spinner, default 'spinner'.

top.doc: Top position relative to parent in px, auto by default.

left.doc: Left position relative to parent in px, auto by default.

carousel.description: Displays an on-screen list of clips in the carousel. When playing the list is hidden, when paused it is displayed

playlist_id.doc: The id of the playlist to be displayed

playlistAPI.description: The Kaltura playlist plugin, supports associating multiple clips in sequence.
playlistAPI.label: Playlist Configuration

includeInLayout.doc: Include clip list in the display.

autoPlay.doc: If the playlist should autoplay on load.

hideClipPoster.doc: Hide clip poster when switching to another clip.

onPage.label: Render on publisher's page
onPage.doc: When unchecked, the playlist will be rendered inside the player's iframe (recommended).

MinClips.doc: Minimum number of clips to show in the playlist without scrolling.

MaxClips.doc: Max number of clips to show in the playlist.

initItemEntryId.doc: The entryId that should be played first.

kpl0Url.doc: The playlist URL. (can be a Kaltura playlist service or MRSS)

kpl1Name.doc: The name of the indexed playlist.

localizationCode.description: Set the language of the Kaltura player user interface. Supports language code or auto to take the browser requested language from JavaScript vars.
localizationCode.doc: language code, or "auto" for browser content language preference

imageDefaultDuration.doc: The duration image entries should be displayed.

requiredMetadataFields.doc: If metadata should be loaded into the player.

metadataProfileId.doc:
The metadata profile ID to be used for custom player metadata.
If unset, will use the latest metadata ID added to that player. It is best to point it at a particular metadata profile ID.
It Will pouplate {mediaProxy.entryMetadata} with the associated custom data.

playbackRateSelector.description: Enables users to select the video playback rate. Note http streamerType must be used to support playbackRateSelector in capable HTML5 browsers.

defaultSpeed.doc: The default speed of the player.

speeds.doc: The set of selectable speeds, where 1 = 100% speed. Seperated by commas.
speeds.label: Selectable speeds

streamSelector.description: Enables users to select the video playback stream out of a selection of streams.

enableKeyboardShortcuts.doc: Enable keyboard shortcuts (Key mappings: "[" - Next, "]" - Previous, "\" - Default)

audioSelector.description: Enables users to select from audio tracks active in the stream.

sourceSelector.description: Enables users to select the video quality.

switchOnResize.doc:
When the player changes size or goes into fullscreen,
					the source will update per playback resolution. By default, the embed size 
					is only taken into consideration at startup.

simpleFormat.doc: Use simple format to restrict to two sources only per named size, and not list content type.

displayMode.doc: Configure the display mode to set the type of information to display in the source selector's menu: size, bit-rate or both.

uiVars.description: Allows you to add UI variables to the player configuration.
uiVars.label: UI Variables

download.description:
Enables users to add a download button to the player controls.
			The download button will enable users to download the media to a local file.

parent.doc: Parent container for component. Components include default placement, leave as null if unsure.

align.doc: Alignment for component, can be left or right.

order.doc:
Draw order of the component within the container.
			Together with alignment, determines component placement of the component. Order is set with respect to siblings on the parent container.

flavorID.label: Flavor ID
flavorID.doc: Flavor ID for the downloaded movie source. When specified, overrides any preferred bitrate settings

preferredBitrate.label: Preferred bitrate
preferredBitrate.doc: Preferred bitrate for the downloaded movie source (when Flavor ID is not specified). Keep empty for the highest bitrate. Enter '0' for the original movie source file

downloadName.label: Download name
downloadName.doc: Defines the name of the downloaded file

flavorParamsId.label: Preferred params id
flavorParamsId.doc: Defines the flavor params id, from the transcoding settings

docPlayToFrom.description: The playFrom and playTo attributes enable building a preview of a segment of content.

mediaProxy.mediaPlayFrom.doc: The start time for the video playback.

mediaProxy.mediaPlayTo.doc: The time in seconds, for the video playback to end.

mediaProxy.preferedFlavorBR.doc: The initial bitrate to be selected.

segmentScrubber.plugin.doc: Virtaulzies the playhead to selected segment of time.

deliveryCode.doc: The deliveryCode is passed along as part of a domain prefix into the stream URL. (can be used for per-embed URL billing categorization)

controlsHolder.description: The controlsHolder enables you to hide or show the control bar.

visible.doc: If the control holder should be visible.
If the control screen holder should be visible.

parent.doc:
The holder for the playhead scrubber. If set to controlsContainer,
					will be inline with the other control buttons.
					If set to controlsBarContainer,will take a full horizontal line

minWidth.doc: The minimum width of the playhead. If the min-width is reached, normal responsive display importance removal rules come into effect.

sliderPreview.doc: Show a preview thumbnail with the current time when mouse is over the scrubber

showOnlyTime.doc: Show only the time when mouse is over the scrubber

segmentScrubber.description:
Playhead Segment enables setting start and end times of a larger stream.
The playhead reflects segment time as if it was the natural stream length.

img.label: Logo image URL
img.doc: URL for custom control bar logo image.

href.label: Logo link
href.doc: URL for the control bar logo to click through to.

cssClass.doc: An additional class to add to the logo. Can be used for CSS based custom logo image.

watermarkPath.doc: URL path to plugin image. For default controls height, logo can be 20 by 20 pixel png.

buttonsColor.label: Button's color
buttonsColor.doc: Button's color. Note: using transparency will disable this color setting in Internet Explorer 8

share.description: Add the share interface to the player.
share.label: Share and Embed

parent.doc: Parent container for component. Components include default placement, leave as null if unsure.

align.doc: Alignment for component, can be left or right.

order.doc:
Draw order of the component within the container.
			Together with alignment, determines component placement of the component. Order is set with respect to siblings on the parent container.

socialShareURL.doc:
Allows you to define the URL shared for this player:

  • smart will maximize inline social sharing playback, by using the page URL or Kaltura URL, and depend on whether opengraph tags are present on the page
  • parent will share the parent page URL.
  • http://my-custom-domain.com/?v={mediaProxy.entry.id} a custom URL with magic substitution can also be used.

socialNetworks.doc: Define included networks, separate by commas. Currently share supports facebook, twitter, googleplus.

embedCodeTemplate.doc: Enables the customization of the embed code template, leave empty to use iframe default.

allowTimeOffset.doc: Allow setting a time offset for the entry.

emailEnabled.doc: Display Email in the share options.

shareUiconfID.doc: Specify a UIConf ID for the shared link. Leave empty to use the current UIConf.

shareConfig.doc: Configuration options for all share networks.

watermarkPath.label: Image URL
watermarkPath.doc: The URL path to the watermark image.

watermarkClickPath.label: Click URL
watermarkClickPath.doc: The URL for the watermark click.

hideTimeout.label: Watermark display duration
hideTimeout.doc: Number of seconds to display the watermark, 0 show always.

padding.label: Padding CSS
padding.doc: Padding CSS property from the edge of the play screen; top right bottom left, or single value.

parent.doc: Parent container for component. Components include default placement, leave as null if unsure.

statistics.description: Use Kaltura statistics to track analytics for the Kaltura player. Statistics are enabled by default.

trackEventMonitor.doc: Use to audit Kaltura events with a named callback function.

playbackContext.doc: The playback context sent to Kaltura analytics.

originFeature.doc: The featureType var sent to Kaltura analytics.

applicationName.doc: For registering the application with Kaltura analytics.

userId.doc: For associating a userId with Kaltura analytics.

myExternalResourcesPlugin.description: The external resources attributes can be applied to a custom plugin by any name. All number keys can be incremneted to load more resources. i.e onPageJs1 onPageJs2 onPageJs3 etc.

onPageJs1.doc: An onPage javascript file is loaded on the client page. More about onPage plugins

onPageCss1.doc: An onPage CSS file is loaded on the client page. More about onPage plugins

iframeHTML5Js1.doc: Javascript to be loaded inside the iframe. More about html5 iframe plugins

iframeHTML5Css.doc: CSS to be loaded inside the iframe. More about html5 iframe plugins

userAgentPlayerRules.description: Sets player default by user agent rules.

disableForceMobileHTML5.doc: Disable the forceMobileHTML5 URL flag. This prevents showing the HTML5 player via the URL flag.

r1RegMatch.doc: First rule, RegMatch postfix means the rule is a regular expression.

r1LeadWithHTML5.doc: Lead with HTML5 action to take for matching the first rule.

r2Match.doc: Second rule, Match postfix means the rule is a simple string search.

r2ForceFlash.doc: Force Flash action to take for matching the second rule.

r3Match.doc: Third rule, Match postfix means the rule is a simple string search.

r3ForceMsg.doc: Force Msg, displays the HTML for matching the third rule. HTML should be escaped.

r4RegMatch.doc: Fourth rule,  RegMatch postfix means the rule is a regular expression.

r4LeadWithHTML5.doc: Fourth action, LeadWithHTML5 means lead with HTML5 for fourth rule match

IframeCustomPluginJs1.doc: URL for the javascript to be loaded in the iframe.

IframeCustomPluginCss1.doc: URL for the CSS to be loaded in the iframe.

onPageJs1.doc: URL for the javascript to be loaded on the embedding page.

onPageCss1.doc: URL for CSS to be loaded on the embedding page.

enableControlsDuringAd.doc: If true, play pause button will be active during ad playback

adsOnReplay.doc: true for showing ads in replay, false to skip ads in replay.

bumper.description: Bumpers, enables a Kaltura entry to be displayed before or after the content.

bumperEntryID.doc: The entry id of the bumper to be played

clickurl.doc: The URL to open when the user clicks the bumper video.
clickurl.label: Click URL

preSequence.doc: The preSequence number for sequencing the bumper before or after ads before content. Also can be set to zero and set postSequence to 1, to have the bumper play after the content
preSequence.label: Pre-sequence index

postSequence.doc: The postSequence number for sequencing the bumper before or after ads after content. Also can be set to zero and set preSequence to 1, to have the bumper play before the content
postSequence.label: Post-sequence index

skipOffset.doc: The time in seconds, before the skip ad link is active.

text.doc: Skip notice text (can use evaluated expressions)
text.label: Skip notice text
text.initvalue: You can skip this ad in {sequenceProxy.skipOffsetRemaining} seconds

text.label: Notice message
text.initvalue: Advertisement: Video will resume in {sequenceProxy.timeRemaining} seconds

vast.label: Vast
vast.description: Kaltura player features robust VAST support for prerolls, midrolls, overlays, companions and postrolls

prerollUrl.doc: The VAST ad tag XML URL.
prerollUrl.label: Preroll URL

prerollUrlJs.doc: The VAST ad tag URL used where platform does not support flash. If undefined all platforms will use the base prerollUrl for ad requests.
prerollUrlJs.label: Preroll JS URL

numPreroll.label: Preroll(s) amount
numPreroll.doc: The number of prerolls to be played.

prerollStartWith.label: Number of prerolls to start with.
prerollStartWith.doc: Number of prerolls to start with.

preSequence.label: VAST pre-sequence index
preSequence.doc: The VAST preSequence index. For example,1 for ads then 2 for a bumper plugin; would result in ad then bumper.

postrollUrl.label: Postroll URL
postrollUrl.doc: The vast ad tag xml url

postrollUrlJs.doc:
The VAST ad tag URL used where platform does not support flash.
			If undefined all platforms will use the base postrollUrl for ad requests.
postrollUrlJs.label: Postroll JS URL

numPostroll.label: Postroll(s) amount
numPostroll.doc: The number of prerolls to be played.

postrollStartWith.doc: Number of postrolls to start with.
postrollStartWith.label: Number of postrolls to start with

postSequence.label: VAST post-sequence index
postSequence.doc: The VAST post-Sequence index. For example, 1 for ads then 2 for a bumper plugin; would result in ad then bumper.

htmlCompanions.label: HTML Companions
htmlCompanions.doc: Companions list. For each companion please specify the ad container div id and the expected ad width and height.

overlayUrl.label: Overlay URL
overlayUrl.doc: The VAST XML file that contains the overlay media and tracking info.

overlayInterval.doc: How often should the overlay be displayed.

timeout.doc: The timeout in seconds, for displaying an overlay VAST ad. If the VAST XML specifies the minSuggestedDuration attribute, this property will be ignored.

trackCuePoints.doc: If entry cuepoints should be tracked for midroll ad requests.

allowSeekWithNativeControls.doc: It allows to catch seek requests during ads and return the player to original play time..

storeSession.doc:
If the frequency playback should be stored across player reloads.
					By default, only playlists respect frequency intervals.
					If set to true, the prerollInterval will be respected across player views.

pauseAdOnClick.doc: If the ad should pause when clicked.

enableCORS.doc: Enable CORS request to support request cookies to secured domains over ajax

loadAdsOnPlay.doc:
By default ads are loaded at player startup time. 
					Setting loadAdsOnPlay to true will load ads only once the user presses play.

keyboardShortcuts.description: The keyboard shortcuts plugins allows you to control the player using keyboard shortcuts. More about JavaScript key mappings

closeFullscreenkey.doc: Close Full Screen Key. Browsers by default supports escape key, independent of keyboard mapping.

gotoBeginingKey.doc: Go to the beginning of the video.

gotoEndKey.doc: Go to the end of the video.

percentageSeekKeys.doc: Comma seperated keys for percentage seek.

volumeControl.description: The volume control plugin allows you to control the player volume using mute/unmute buttons and a volume slider.

pinVolumeBar.doc: If the volume slider bar should always be shown.

accessibleControls.doc: Accessible buttons volume change percent from 0 to 1: The amount of volume that will be added or reduced when using the accessible volume buttons.

accessibleVolumeChange.doc: Accessible buttons volume change percent from 0 to 1.

accessibilityButtons.description: The accessibility buttons allow keyboard access to seek forward/backward and current position.

restrictUserAgent.description: Allows you to block the player to specific user agents.

restrictedUserAgents.doc: Comma seperated list of browsers to search for.

captureThumbnail.description: Allow your users to capture a thumbnail from the video content. A KS must be supplied to ingest the reqspective thubmnail.

plugin.doc: If the plugin should be activated

moderation.description: Allow your users to flag content as inapproriate.

header.doc: Header text to show above the form.

infoScreen.description: Add Information screen about the video.

parent.doc: Parent container for component. Components include default placement, leave as null if unsure.

align.doc: Alignment for component, can be left or right.

order.doc:
Draw order of the component within the container.
			Together with alignment, determines component placement of the component. Order is set with respect to siblings on the parent container.

template.doc: HTML Template for the info screen.

titleLabel.description: Enables a title hover overlay over the video content.

text.doc: The text string to be displayed for the title.

truncateLongTitles.doc: Truncate long titles to fit in one line. Truncated titles get a tooltip and 3 dots at the end of the truncated text.

dualScreen.label: Dual Screen
dualScreen.description: The Kaltura Player is the front-end interface used to view captured videos and/or presentations. The Kaltura Player provides you with multiple interactive viewing options, such as Picture-in-Picture, Side-by-Side, and other displays

options.label: Side by Side / parent in right
Side by Side / parent in left
Picture in Picture / parent in small view
Picture in Picture / parent in large view

airPlay.description: Enables wireless streaming of audio, video, and photos, together with related metadata between devices, for iOS.
airPlay.label: airPlay

nativeCallout.description: Supports replacing the player "play button" with a callout to native player, for Mobile Devices.

appInstallLandingPage.doc: Landing page for app install; shown if applink URL is not a web page.

related.description: Add the Related Videos screen at the end of the video to attract users to watch additional videos.

parent.doc: Parent container for component. Components include default placement, leave as null if unsure.

align.doc: Alignment for component, can be left or right.

order.doc:
Draw order of the component within the container.
			Together with alignment, determines component placement of the component. Order is set with respect to siblings on the parent container.

clickUrl.doc:
Defines the URL for a related item click

If this left blank the click will replace the current video with a new one. example: http://mydomain.com/?videoId={related.selectedEntry.id} as a custom URL with the entry id as postfix

autoContinueTime.doc: Number of seconds for auto play.

itemsLimit.doc: Maximum number of items to show on the related screen.

displayOnPlaybackDone.doc: Display related screen automatically when playback has finished

sendContextWithPlaylist.doc: Send context with the playlist (_KDP_CTXPL sends this automatically)

autoContinueEnabled.doc: Should the Next Item be automatically played.

storeSession.doc: Store the played entries across page views in related clips display

strings.description:
Enables overwriting player strings.
For full string keys listing, review the Strings documentation page.
You can override strings seperately for different locales by adding the locale code before the string key and then a dot. For more info, look at the Strings locale demo.
strings.label: Strings

keyValuePairs.doc: Key / Value pairs of strings to overwrite
keyValuePairs.label: Strings to overwrite:

hammerEvents.description: Support Hammer.js events against the player canvas.

on.doc: The list of named hammer events to track seperated by spaces.

options.doc: JSON object of hammer initialization options
